Author: Tichy
Content:
I usually assume that homeless people are suffering from some mental illness or severe addiction that prevents them from getting back into society.

It would be great to know more about their backgrounds, but so far I haven't figured out a good way of doing it - they probably are not too keen on making their sad state public.

Author: timr
Content:
Oy, the echo chamber!

This tempest in a teapot started when the New York Times wrote a rather comical article on how Seattle is the new silicon valley:

http://www.nytimes.com/2008/02/08/technology/08nation.html

The entrepreneur blogger at the Seattle PI picked this up, and started a debate:

http://blog.seattlepi.nwsource.com/venture/archives/131378.a...

In response to this debate, Kelman wrote a long post enumerating the ways that he thought Seattle was better than the valley:

http://blog.redfin.com/blog/2008/02/the_next_silicon_valley....

And now, we have this.

Content: That is shockingly believable data and speaks of how terrible it is to use the internet on any phone other than an iPhone.

Author: jgrahamc
Content:
I mean, it's in your best interest to push the funded companies into success by suggesting new/complementary features.

That assumes that pg (or any other person funding a company) is an oracle of what will make the company successful. The reality is that pg et al. are going to succeed by being good judges of founder character. Once they have the right founders, the founders themselves will figure out what it best to make their business suceed and pg wealthier.
